raw_comment:
I notice that the western border and southern states first leaves appear much earlier than those of the northern states.
I wonder why the first leaves begin appearing in the southernmost states as opposed to the northern states.
I know that the southern states are much closer to the equator than the northern states which allows for much more exposure to the sun. This extra exposure speeds up the growth rate for plants to sprout leaves which is why the states closest to the equator have their first leaves appearing the earliest.
ace_sentences: I notice a difference between the western border states and the northern states.
The first leaves in the western border states appear earlier than the first leaves in the northern states.
I notice a difference between the southern states and the northern states.
The first leaves in the southern states appear earlier than the first leaves in the northern states.
I wonder why the first leaves begin appearing in the southernmost states and not in the northern states.
The southern states are closer to the equator than the northern states.
If a state is closer to the equator, then the state has more exposure to the sun.
If a state has more exposure to the sun, then the growth rate of plants increases.
If the growth rate of plants increases, then the plants sprout leaves earlier.
Therefore, the states that are closest to the equator have their first leaves appearing earliest.
